chunk_00001.caption:
### **SCENE SETTING:**
Monica’s apartment living room — evening, warm indoor lighting with visible lamps and decor.

### **CHARACTERS PRESENT:**
Rachel Green: light-colored shirt - denim overalls - brown, shoulder-length hair - concerned expression
Monica Geller: dark-colored sweater - jeans - dark, shoulder-length hair - animated expression
Phoebe Buffay: patterned top - dark pants - blonde, long hair - smiling expression
Chandler Bing: red sweater - dark pants - dark, short hair - focused expression
Joey Tribbiani: dark jacket - light-colored shirt - dark, medium-length hair - relaxed expression
Ross Geller: dark-colored top - dark pants - dark, short hair - serious expression

### **ACTIONS AND INTERACTIONS:**
Rachel sits on a chair holding a bowl of popcorn, looking concerned as she speaks to Monica. Monica stands near the couch, gesturing animatedly while talking. Phoebe sits on the couch, smiling and listening. Chandler sits on the couch, focused on a remote control. Joey sits beside Chandler, looking relaxed. Ross sits on the couch, appearing serious as he listens to the conversation. The group is gathered in the living room, engaged in a discussion.

### **OBJECTS AND PROPS:**
- Bowl of popcorn: blue rim (on table)
- Remote control: black (in Chandler’s hand)
- Coffee mugs: various colors (on table)
- Orange couch (center of frame)
- Wooden coffee table (center)
- Framed photos (on shelves)
- Lamp (on side table)
- Cat (on floor near couch)

### **DIALOGUE CONTEXT:**
Rachel discusses an incident involving a fall from a balcony with Monica. The conversation has a serious tone, with Rachel appearing concerned and Monica reacting with animated gestures. The group listens intently, with Chandler focused on the remote and Joey appearing relaxed.

### **TEMPORAL NOTES:**
Rachel stands up and walks toward the door, then returns to her seat. Monica moves from standing to sitting on the couch. Chandler picks up the remote control and begins to use it. Joey shifts his position slightly while sitting. Ross remains seated throughout the scene.
chunk_00001.subtitles: NARRATOR: Previously on Friends: - Excuse me, miss. - It's Phoebe. - Will that be all? CHANDLER: They're twins. Phoebe's Phoebe. Ursula's hot. - It's for Ursula. - Sure, yeah. Okay, it fits. Marcel, give Rossy the remote. [SPEAKING IN SPANISH] How did he do this? It's this whole stupid Ursula thing. So he's going out with her. Is it really so terrible? - You don't know my sister. - Talk to Joey. - He's falling in love with her. - You won't lose him. They haven't even slept together yet. That's not serious. Oh. Um, yeah. May we help you? [RACHEL YELLS] Rachel! Rachel! I'm okay. I'm okay. RACHEL: Ow, ow, ow. Ow, ow, ow. Ow, ow, ow. Ow, ow, ow. Uh, hi, uh, my friend was taking down our Christmas lights... ...and she fell off the balcony and may have broken her foot or ankle.

chunk_00002.caption:
### **SCENE SETTING:**
A medical clinic or hospital waiting area — daytime, bright fluorescent lighting. The setting includes a reception desk, waiting chairs, and a visible "EXIT" sign.

### **CHARACTERS PRESENT:**
Rachel Green: brown jacket - blue jeans - long, light brown hair - concerned expression
Monica Geller: dark-colored jacket - dark pants - dark, shoulder-length hair - serious expression

### **ACTIONS AND INTERACTIONS:**
Rachel and Monica sit on a waiting couch, engaged in a serious conversation. Monica holds a clipboard and pencil, writing notes while speaking to Rachel, who gestures with her hands as she responds. Rachel appears distressed and is looking down at her foot, which Monica is examining. Monica's expression is focused and concerned as she listens and writes.

### **OBJECTS AND PROPS:**
- Clipboard: black (held by Monica)
- Pencil: yellow (held by Monica)
- Waiting chairs: beige (in background)
- Reception desk: blue (in foreground)
- Plants: green (in background)

### **DIALOGUE CONTEXT:**
Monica discusses a medical issue with Rachel, specifically about a possible injury to Rachel's foot. The conversation has a serious and concerned tone, with Monica appearing focused and Rachel reacting with distress and concern. Monica is taking notes while speaking, indicating she is documenting the situation.

### **TEMPORAL NOTES:**
Rachel and Monica move from standing at the reception desk to sitting on the couch. Monica begins writing on the clipboard while talking to Rachel. Rachel looks down at her foot and gestures with her hands as she speaks.
chunk_00002.subtitles: ...and she fell off the balcony and may have broken her foot or ankle. My God, you still have your Christmas lights up? Fill this out and bring it back. - Okay. Here you go. - Ow, ow, ow. Ow, ow, ow. MONICA: Okay. Whew. All right. Name... ...address... Okay. In case of emergency, call? You. Really? Yeah. Oh, that is so sweet. Oh, gosh. I love you. Okay, insurance? Oh, yeah, check it. Definitely gonna want some of that. You don't have insurance? Why? How much is this gonna cost? I have no idea, but X-rays alone could be a couple hundred dollars. - What are we gonna do? - There's not much we can do. Uh, unless I use yours. No, no, no, no, no. Well, now, wait a second. Who did I just put as my "in case of emergency" person?

chunk_00003.caption:
### **SCENE SETTING:**
Hospital emergency room waiting area — daytime, fluorescent lighting
Central Perk coffee shop — daytime, warm ambient lighting

### **CHARACTERS PRESENT:**
Monica Geller: dark-colored sweater - jeans - dark, shoulder-length hair - animated
Rachel Green: brown jacket over white t-shirt and denim overalls - long, wavy brown hair - concerned
Unidentified person: light-colored shirt - dark pants - short, dark hair - neutral
Ross Geller: dark suit jacket - light shirt - patterned tie - dark, short hair - serious
Chandler Bing: green sweater - dark pants - short, brown hair - concerned
Joey Tribbiani: blue sweater - dark pants - short, brown hair - concerned

### **ACTIONS AND INTERACTIONS:**
Monica stands at the hospital reception desk, gesturing and speaking animatedly to a nurse while Rachel sits nearby looking concerned. Ross, Chandler, and Joey are seated on the couch at Central Perk, reading newspapers and reacting with concern as Ross speaks. Monica walks away from the desk after receiving papers, while Rachel follows her. Ross continues talking, gesturing with his hands, while Chandler and Joey listen intently.

### **OBJECTS AND PROPS:**
- Clipboard with papers (held by Monica)
- Pencil (held by Monica)
- Coffee mugs: various colors (on table)
- Orange couch (center of frame)
- Wooden table (with newspapers)
- Bar stools (in background)
- Emergency room sign (visible in background)

### **DIALOGUE CONTEXT:**
Monica discusses her mistake of filling out a friend's emergency form with her own information with the nurse. The conversation has a humorous tone, with Monica appearing apologetic and the nurse reacting with exasperation. Rachel listens with concern, while Ross, Chandler, and Joey react with concern and amusement to Ross's story about his dream involving a baby and football.

### **TEMPORAL NOTES:**
Monica stands up and walks to the reception desk
Rachel follows Monica to the reception desk
Ross stands up and begins speaking
Chandler and Joey shift their attention to Ross
Monica walks away from the desk after receiving papers
chunk_00003.subtitles: Who did I just put as my "in case of emergency" person? That's insurance fraud. Well, all right, then. Forget it. Might as well just go home. - Ow, ow, ow, ow! - Okay, okay. - Okay, come here. I hate this. - Thank you. I love you. Hi, heh. Um, I'm gonna need a new set of these forms. Why? [LAUGHING] I am really an idiot. You see, I was filling out my friend's form... ...and instead of putting her information... ...I put mine. You are an idiot. Yep, that's me. Heh. I am that stupid. I had a dream last night where I was playing football with my kid. - That's nice. - That's nice. No, no. With him. I'm on this field, and they hike me the baby. I know I've gotta do something because the Tampa Bay defense is coming right at me.

chunk_00004.caption:
### **SCENE SETTING:**
Central Perk coffee shop — daytime, warm ambient lighting with visible interior decor.

### **CHARACTERS PRESENT:**
Ross Geller: dark-colored suit jacket - light-colored shirt - dark, short hair - animated, speaking expressively
Chandler Bing: dark-colored sweater - dark pants - dark, medium-length hair - serious, listening
Joey Tribbiani: blue sweater - dark pants - dark, medium-length hair - concerned, listening

### **ACTIONS AND INTERACTIONS:**
Ross Geller stands and gestures emphatically while speaking to Chandler and Joey, who are seated on the orange couch. Chandler leans forward, listening intently with a serious expression, while Joey sits beside him, also listening with a concerned look. Ross continues to speak animatedly, using hand gestures to emphasize his points.

### **OBJECTS AND PROPS:**
- Coffee mugs: various colors (on table)
- Orange couch (center of frame)
- Wooden table (with mugs and plates)
- Book (on table, partially visible)
- Bar stools (in background)

### **DIALOGUE CONTEXT:**
Ross Geller discusses his fears about being a father and the Tampa Bay defense with Chandler and Joey. The conversation has a serious, slightly humorous tone, with Ross appearing animated and concerned, and Chandler and Joey reacting with serious expressions and attentive listening.

### **TEMPORAL NOTES:**
None observed.
chunk_00004.subtitles: I know I've gotta do something because the Tampa Bay defense is coming right at me. Tampa Bay's got a terrible team. Right, but... ...it is just me and the baby, so I'm thinking they can take us. And so I, uh, heh... I just heave it downfield. What are you, crazy? That's a baby. He should take the sack? Anyway, suddenly I'm downfield. And I realize that I'm the one who's supposed to catch him, right? Only I know there's no way I'm not gonna get there in time. So I am running and I'm running... ...and that is when I woke up. See, I am so not ready to be a father. Hey, you're gonna be fine. You're one of the most caring, responsible men in North America. You're gonna make a great dad. Yeah, Ross. You and the baby just need better blocking. Oh. Have either of you ever been to the Rainbow Room? Is it expensive?

chunk_00005.caption:
### **SCENE SETTING:**
Central Perk coffee shop — daytime, warm ambient lighting with natural light from windows

### **CHARACTERS PRESENT:**
Chandler Bing: dark green jacket - dark pants - dark, styled hair - animated, engaged
Ross Geller: dark suit - light shirt - patterned tie - dark pants - dark, short hair - serious, concerned
Joey Tribbiani: blue cable-knit sweater - dark pants - dark, styled hair - smiling, relaxed

### **ACTIONS AND INTERACTIONS:**
Chandler, Ross, and Joey are seated on an orange couch, engaged in conversation. Chandler gestures with his hands while speaking, Ross listens intently with a serious expression, and Joey smiles and nods along. Ross picks up a red cup from the table and takes a sip. The scene cuts to a hospital room where Rachel Green, wearing overalls, sits on a gurney while a nurse attends to her; Ross enters the room wearing scrubs and a stethoscope, looking concerned.

### **OBJECTS AND PROPS:**
- Coffee mugs: green, blue, red (on table)
- Orange couch (center of frame)
- Wooden coffee table (with papers and plates)
- Newspaper (on table)
- Hospital gurney (in hospital room)
- Medical equipment (in hospital room)

### **DIALOGUE CONTEXT:**
Ross discusses taking Ursula to the Rainbow Room for her birthday with Chandler and Joey. The conversation has a casual, slightly tense tone, with Ross appearing concerned and Chandler animatedly explaining his plans. Joey reacts with amusement, smiling and nodding.

### **TEMPORAL NOTES:**
- Scene cuts from Central Perk to a hospital room
- Ross picks up and drinks from a red cup
- Ross enters the hospital room wearing scrubs
chunk_00005.subtitles: Oh. Have either of you ever been to the Rainbow Room? Is it expensive? Only if you order stuff. I'm taking Ursula tonight. It's her birthday. - Whoa. What about Phoebe's birthday? - When's that? ROSS: Uh... ...tonight. Ugh, man, what are the odds of that happening? You take your time. There it is. So, what are you gonna do? What can I do? I don't want to screw it up with Ursula. And your friend Phoebe? If she's my friend, hopefully she'll understand. Wouldn't you guys? Man, if you tried that on my birthday... ...you'd be staring at the business end of a hissy fit. You add a pinch of saffron, it makes all the difference. Okay, uh...

chunk_00006.caption:
### **SCENE SETTING:**
Hospital examination room — daytime, clinical fluorescent lighting
Apartment living room — evening, warm ambient lighting with party decorations

### **CHARACTERS PRESENT:**
Rachel Green: light-colored shirt - denim overalls - brown, shoulder-length hair - smiling, animated
Monica Geller: dark-colored sweater with red and white pattern - black pants - dark, shoulder-length hair - smiling, engaged
Dr. Mitchell: light blue scrubs - stethoscope - dark hair - smiling, attentive
Dr. Rosen: light blue scrubs - stethoscope - dark hair - smiling, attentive
Unidentified person: dark-colored top - unclear pants - dark hair - partially visible

### **ACTIONS AND INTERACTIONS:**
Rachel and Monica sit on a hospital bed, talking and gesturing to each other while the two doctors stand nearby, holding clipboards and smiling. The doctors engage in conversation with the women, appearing friendly and amused. The scene transitions to an apartment decorated with balloons and party banners, where Rachel and Monica stand near a table with snacks, conversing with the doctors and another man. Rachel holds a bag of chips, while Monica holds a bowl, and they appear to be discussing the doctors' romantic invitations.

### **OBJECTS AND PROPS:**
Hospital bed (covered with white sheet)
Medical equipment (including IV stand and wall-mounted devices)
Clipboards (held by doctors)
Table with bowls of snacks (including chips and popcorn)
Balloon decorations (colorful, clustered near ceiling)
Party banner (reading "HAPPY BIRTHDAY")
Kitchen counter (with stove and shelves)
Coffee mugs (on table)
Glass bottles (on counter)

### **DIALOGUE CONTEXT:**
Rachel and Monica discuss the doctors' romantic invitations, with Monica expressing concern about the situation. The conversation has a lighthearted, joking tone, with Rachel appearing amused and Monica appearing slightly skeptical. The doctors respond with smiles and laughter, indicating their amusement at the situation.

### **TEMPORAL NOTES:**
Scene transitions from hospital room to apartment living room
Rachel and Monica move from sitting on the bed to standing near the table
Doctors move from standing near the bed to standing near the table
Monica picks up a bowl of snacks
Rachel holds a bag of chips and gestures while speaking
chunk_00006.subtitles: Okay, uh... - Monica? - Yes? Yes, she is. - Hi. This is my friend Rachel. - Hi. Hi, uh, Rachel, I'm Dr. Mitchell. And I'm his friend Dr. Rosen. Aren't you a little cute to be a doctor? Excuse me? God, young, young. I meant young, heh. Young to be a doctor. - Oh, good, Rach. - Thank you. Right. [R.E.M.'S "WHAT'S THE FREQUENCY, KENNETH?" PLAYING ON STEREO] So he said it was just a sprain, and that was it. Uh, you left out the stupid part. It's not stupid. The very cute doctors asked us out for tomorrow night, and I said yes. I think it's totally insane. I mean, they work for the hospital. It's like returning to the scene of the crime. - I say we blow off the dates. - What? Monica, they are cute. They are doctors. Cute doctors. Doctors who are cute.

chunk_00007.caption:
### **SCENE SETTING:**
Monica’s apartment living room — evening, warm ambient lighting with decorative balloons and string lights indicating a party atmosphere.

### **CHARACTERS PRESENT:**
Rachel Green: light-colored plaid dress - brown long hair - smiling, animated
Monica Geller: dark-colored sweater - patterned skirt - dark shoulder-length hair - smiling, engaged
Chandler Bing: light-colored shirt with dark vest - dark pants - short brown hair - smiling, clapping
Ross Geller: dark-colored coat over vest and shirt - patterned tie - short dark hair - serious, then surprised
Joey Tribbiani: dark jacket over white shirt - dark pants - medium-length brown hair - smiling, observing
Phoebe Buffay: dark top - long blonde hair - smiling, observing
Unidentified person: plaid shirt - bald - holding a drink, observing

### **ACTIONS AND INTERACTIONS:**
Rachel and Monica are preparing food in the kitchen area, with Monica dancing excitedly. Chandler claps and gestures as he joins them. Ross enters through the door holding a pink gift box, which he places on the floor before picking it up. The group gathers around the coffee table as Ross opens the gift, with Monica and Chandler leaning in to look. Rachel, Joey, and Phoebe stand nearby, smiling and watching the interaction. The group is gathered in a celebratory mood, with balloons and decorations visible.

### **OBJECTS AND PROPS:**
- Balloons: multicolored, hanging from ceiling and walls
- Coffee table: wooden, with wrapped gifts and bowls of food
- Couch: white, with patterned pillows
- Kitchen counter: blue cabinets, with various kitchen items
- Gift box: pink wrapping paper, on floor then on table
- Food bowls: various snacks and food items on table

### **DIALOGUE CONTEXT:**
Ross discusses the surprise party with the group, with Rachel and Monica reacting with excitement. The conversation has a happy, celebratory tone, with Ross appearing surprised and Monica animatedly engaging with him. The group reacts by smiling and gathering around the gift, indicating a joyful birthday celebration.

### **TEMPORAL NOTES:**
Ross enters the apartment and places the gift box on the floor before picking it up.
Monica dances and moves around the room.
Chandler claps and gestures as he joins the group.
The group gathers around the coffee table as Ross opens the gift.
chunk_00007.subtitles: They are doctors. Cute doctors. Doctors who are cute. All right, what have we learned so far? [KNOCK ON DOOR] [MUSIC STOPS] ALL: Surprise! What the hell are you doing? You scared the crap out of me. - Was that the cake? - Yeah. I got a lemon shmush. Come on. She'll be here any minute. RACHEL: I hope it's okay. "Happy Birthday, Peehee." Maybe we can make a B out of one of those roses. Yeah, we'll just use our special cake tools. - Hey, what's going on? CHANDLER: Oh, we just... ALL: Surprise! Oh, oh, oh! This is so great. Oh, my God.

chunk_00008.caption:
### **SCENE SETTING:**
Monica’s apartment living room — evening, warm artificial lighting with festive decorations visible.

### **CHARACTERS PRESENT:**

Phoebe Buffay: dark top - green patterned cardigan - blonde, long hair - smiling
Chandler Bing: dark-colored shirt - dark pants - brown, short hair - relaxed
Ross Geller: dark sweater - dark pants - brown, short hair - serious
Joey Tribbiani: dark-colored shirt - dark pants - brown, short hair - smiling
Monica Geller: dark top - patterned pants - dark, shoulder-length hair - animated
Unidentified person: dark shirt - dark pants - dark hair - smiling

### **ACTIONS AND INTERACTIONS:**
Rachel stands near the center of the room, smiling and gesturing as she talks to Phoebe, who is holding a small dog. Chandler stands nearby, smiling and listening. Ross stands beside Monica, who is animatedly talking and gesturing. Joey stands near the doorway, smiling and holding a drink. The group is gathered in a circle, interacting and laughing.

### **OBJECTS AND PROPS:**
- Balloons: colorful (in background)
- Gifts: wrapped (on coffee table)
- Coffee table: wooden, with gifts on it
- Couch: white, with patterned pillows

### **DIALOGUE CONTEXT:**
Rachel discusses a topic with Phoebe, who is holding a small dog. The conversation has a casual, happy tone, with Rachel appearing animated and Phoebe reacting by smiling and laughing.

### **TEMPORAL NOTES:**
None observed.
chunk_00008.subtitles: Oh, my God. This was not at all scary. Hi, everybody. Hi, Betty. Betty, hi. You found Betty. Oh, my gosh. This is so great. Everybody I love is in the same room. Where's Joey? Did you see Betty? I tell you, I wouldn't mind having a piece of this sun-dried-tomato business. Five years ago, if somebody'd said to me, "Here's a tomato that looks like a prune"... ...I'd have said, "Get out of my office." Dad, before I was born, did you freak out at all? I'm not freaking out. I'm just saying... ...if someone had come to me with the idea... Dad, Dad, Dad. I'm talking about the whole, uh, baby thing. Did you, uh, ever get this sort of... ...panicky, "Oh, my God, I'm gonna be a father" kind of a thing?

chunk_00009.caption:
### **SCENE SETTING:**
A restaurant dining room — evening, warm ambient lighting with decorative wall art and a floral arrangement visible.

### **CHARACTERS PRESENT:**
Ross Geller: dark-colored knit sweater - unclear lower clothing - short, dark hair - serious, engaged expression
Unidentified person: dark-colored jacket - unclear lower clothing - curly hair - animated, expressive expression

### **ACTIONS AND INTERACTIONS:**
Ross Geller sits at a table, eating and talking animatedly with the unidentified person across from him. The unidentified person, who has curly hair, listens intently, then responds with expressive gestures and facial reactions, at one point eating while speaking. Ross uses hand gestures to emphasize his points during the conversation.

### **OBJECTS AND PROPS:**
- Glasses: clear (on table)
- Bread basket: white (on table)
- Flower arrangement: red and yellow flowers in a dark vase (on side table)
- Table setting: white tablecloth, cutlery, condiments

### **DIALOGUE CONTEXT:**
Ross Geller discusses becoming a father with the unidentified person. The conversation has a serious yet warm tone, with Ross appearing earnest and the unidentified person reacting with thoughtful listening and expressive responses.

### **TEMPORAL NOTES:**
None observed.
chunk_00009.subtitles: ...panicky, "Oh, my God, I'm gonna be a father" kind of a thing? No. Your mother really did the work. I was busy with the business. I wasn't around that much. Is that what this is about? No, no, Dad. I was just wondering. There's time to make up for that. We can do stuff together. You always wanted to go to colonial Williamsburg. How about we do that? Thanks, Dad. Really, heh. You know, I just, I just... I just needed to know, um... ...when did you start to feel like a father? Oh. Well, I guess it must have been the day after you were born. We were in the hospital room, your mother was asleep... ...and they brought you in and gave you to me. You were this ugly little red thing. [CHUCKLES] And all of a sudden, you grabbed my finger with your whole fist... ...and you squeezed it... ...so tight.

chunk_00010.caption:
### **SCENE SETTING:**
Monica’s apartment living room — evening, warm artificial lighting with visible lamps and decor.

### **CHARACTERS PRESENT:**
Ross Geller: light-colored jacket - light shirt - dark, short hair - smiling
Rachel Green: white shirt - dark pants - shoulder-length brown hair - animated
Monica Geller: dark-colored top - dark pants - dark, shoulder-length hair - smiling
Joey Tribbiani: dark-colored jacket - light shirt - dark, medium-length hair - smiling
Chandler Bing: light-colored shirt - dark pants - dark, medium-length hair - smiling

### **ACTIONS AND INTERACTIONS:**
Ross Geller and Chandler Bing enter the apartment, greeted by Rachel Green who is holding a bottle of wine. Monica Geller stands nearby, smiling. The group gathers together, with Ross holding the wine bottle and Rachel looking at it with interest. Monica gestures toward the others, appearing to explain something. The group stands in a semi-circle, engaged in conversation.

### **OBJECTS AND PROPS:**
- Wine bottle: dark glass (held by Ross)
- Television: on, showing a talk show (in background)
- Wooden dresser: with framed posters (in background)
- Sofa: with patterned cushions (in background)
- Blue door: with ornate gold frame (visible)
- Kitchen area: visible in background with blue cabinets

### **DIALOGUE CONTEXT:**
Ross Geller and Chandler Bing discuss bringing wine to Monica’s apartment, referencing it as being from the cellars of Ernest and Tova Borgnine. Monica Geller appears to be explaining her ankle injury to the group. The conversation has a casual, friendly tone, with Rachel Green appearing excited and Monica Geller smiling as she speaks. The group reacts with interest and amusement.

### **TEMPORAL NOTES:**
Ross Geller and Chandler Bing enter the apartment from the doorway.
Rachel Green moves from the kitchen area to the center of the room.
Monica Geller gestures toward the group while speaking.
Ross Geller holds the wine bottle and presents it to the group.
chunk_00010.subtitles: ...so tight. And that's when I knew. So you don't want to go to Williamsburg? We can go to Williamsburg. Eat your fish. [SPEAKING IN SPANISH] [KNOCK ON DOOR] MONICA: Rachel, the cute doctors are here. RACHEL: Okay, coming. Hi, come on in. Hey, Michael, Jeffrey. - Hi. - Hi. Uh, here, we brought wine. Look at this. It's from the cellars of Ernest and Tova Borgnine. - So how could we resist? - Oh, that's great. - So, Monica, how's the ankle? - It's, uh... [RACHEL CLEARS THROAT] Why don't you tell them? After all, it is your ankle. You know, it's feeling a lot better. Thank you. Listen, why don't you guys sit down, and we'll get you some glasses. - Okay. - Okay. - Um... - Stat.

chunk_00011.caption:
### **SCENE SETTING:**
Monica’s apartment kitchen and living room — evening, warm indoor lighting with visible lamps and ambient room lighting.

### **CHARACTERS PRESENT:**
Rachel Green: light-colored blouse - dark pants - shoulder-length brown hair - smiling/animated
Monica Geller: dark-colored top - striped apron - dark, shoulder-length hair - serious/concerned
Chandler Bing: light-colored shirt - dark pants - short brown hair - relaxed/smiling
Ross Geller: light-colored shirt - dark jacket - dark hair - serious/concerned
Joey Tribbiani: dark-colored shirt - dark pants - dark, medium-length hair - smiling/relaxed

### **ACTIONS AND INTERACTIONS:**
Rachel and Monica are in the kitchen, with Monica holding a wine bottle and Rachel pouring wine into glasses. Monica gestures animatedly while speaking to Rachel, who responds and then walks toward the living room. Ross and Chandler are seated on the couch, engaged in conversation, with Ross appearing serious and Chandler relaxed. Joey enters from the kitchen area holding two wine glasses and walks toward the living room.

### **OBJECTS AND PROPS:**
- Wine bottle: dark-colored (on counter)
- Wine glasses: dark blue (being poured into)
- Refrigerator: white (with magnets and photos)
- Kitchen counter: blue (with various items)
- Couch: light-colored (with pillows)
- Lamp: wooden base with lampshade (on side table)
- Picture frame: gold (on side table)
- Flowers: red and pink (in vase on counter)

### **DIALOGUE CONTEXT:**
Rachel discusses the idea of telling others who they really are with Monica, who is concerned about getting in trouble. Ross and Chandler are talking about their experiences with women they meet at the hospital, with Ross being serious and Chandler relaxed. The conversation has a casual tone, with Rachel appearing animated and Monica concerned, while Ross and Chandler are engaged in their discussion.

### **TEMPORAL NOTES:**
Rachel walks from the kitchen to the living room.
Monica pours wine into glasses.
Joey enters from the kitchen holding wine glasses and walks toward the living room.
chunk_00011.subtitles: - Um... - Stat. Okay, listen, I'm thinking, why don't we just tell them who we really are? - I mean, I think it'll be fine. - It will not. We'll get in trouble. Monica, would you stop being such a wuss? A wuss? Excuse me for living in the real world. - So? - So they still seem normal. That's because they are. You have to admit, when we go out with women we meet at the hospital... Would you relax? Take a look around. There are no pagan altars. No piles of bones in the corners. They're fine. Go like this: I said we are not going to do it, okay? Sometimes you can be such a big baby. - I am not a baby. - Be serious. - You get uptight... - You act like a princess. - You know what? You know what? - What? What? Every day you are becoming more and more like your mother. Excuse me. Hello, here we go. This is a great place. How long have you lived here?

Monica gestures while speaking, and Ross and Chandler react with smiles.
chunk_00012.subtitles: This is a great place. How long have you lived here? Thanks. I've been here about six years. And Rachel moved in a few months ago. See, I was supposed to get married... ...but, um, I left the guy at the altar. - Really? - Yeah. Yeah, I know it's pretty selfish, but, heh... ...hey, that's me. - Why don't you try the hummus? RACHEL: Ahem. So, Monica, what do you do? Uh, I am a, uh, chef at a restaurant uptown. - Oh, good for you. - Yeah, it is. Mostly because I get to boss people around, which I just love to do. Well, this hummus is great. God bless the chickpea. [LAUGHING] Oh, God. I am so spoiled.

Monica sits on the couch, gesturing expressively while speaking to Ross and Chandler. Rachel sits in a chair nearby, listening intently and reacting with concern. Chandler leans back in his chair, smiling as he listens. Joey sits beside Ross, also listening to the conversation. Ross stands up and walks toward the phone, answering it while the others continue talking.

Rachel stands up and walks toward the phone
Monica stands up and walks toward the phone
Rachel sits back down in her chair
chunk_00013.subtitles: That's it. And by the way, have I mentioned that back in high school... ...I was a cow? I used to wet my bed. I use my breasts to get other people's attention. We both do that. [PHONE RINGING] Monica and Rachel's apartment. Uh... Uh, yeah, just one second. Uh, Rachel, it's your dad. Hi, Dad. No, no. It's me. Listen, Dad, I can't talk right now. Um... But there's something, um... There's something that I've been meaning to tell you. Excuse me. Remember back in freshman year?

chunk_00014.caption:
### **SCENE SETTING:**

Chandler Bing: striped shirt - unclear lower clothing - dark, medium-length hair - focused
Joey Tribbiani: unclear clothing - unclear hair - unclear expression (not visible in frame)

### **ACTIONS AND INTERACTIONS:**
Monica stands in the kitchen area, talking on a cordless phone while gesturing. Rachel enters from a doorway, looking surprised, and approaches Monica. Ross sits on the couch, writing on a notepad. Chandler sits beside him, focused on a board game on the coffee table. A black cat climbs onto the couch and moves around. Monica and Rachel have a tense conversation near the TV, with Monica holding the phone and Rachel gesturing back.

### **DIALOGUE CONTEXT:**
Monica discusses a hospital-related issue with Rachel, who appears concerned. The conversation has a tense tone, with Monica appearing stressed and Rachel reacting with worry. Ross and Chandler are focused on their game, seemingly unaware of the urgency.

### **TEMPORAL NOTES:**
Rachel enters the room from the doorway.
Monica moves from the kitchen area to the living room.
The black cat climbs onto the couch and moves around.
Monica and Rachel move closer to the TV to continue their conversation.
chunk_00014.subtitles: Remember back in freshman year? Well, Billy Dreskin and I had sex on your bed. Daddy... Daddy... Daddy, why? Why would I sleep with Billy Dreskin? His father tried to put you out of business. You are dead. Ross, he's got the remote again. Good. Maybe he can switch it back. [SPEAKING IN SPANISH] Maybe not. Hello? Uh, ueah... Uh... Okay, uh, hold on a second and let me just check and see if she's here. It's the woman from the hospital. There's a problem with the form. Oh, God, what do we do? I don't know. Just find out what they want. Okay. No, you do it.

Rachel stands near Monica, holding a phone and talking animatedly while gesturing. Monica listens, then turns and walks toward the group seated on the couch. Phoebe and Chandler sit on the couch, looking concerned as Rachel speaks. Joey enters from the doorway and sits down beside Chandler. Monica listens intently, while Phoebe and Chandler look on with concern.

Joey enters the room from the doorway and sits down

chunk_00015.subtitles: Okay. No, you do it. Hello. This is Monica. Yeah? Oh. Okay. Yes, we'll be right down. Thank you. We forgot to sign one of the admissions forms. - Okay, you're right, this wasn't worth it. - Thank you. - Okay, let me just change. - Yes. - Hey. - Hey. Trouble? Your sister stood me up the other night. Oh, no. Don't you hate it when people aren't there for you? - Did you try calling her? - I've been trying for two days. When I called the restaurant, they said she was too busy to talk. I can't believe she's blowing me off.

The second woman, holding a plate of food, listens and responds, then pulls out a colorful bag and a blue thermos from it. chunk_00016.subtitles: Hey. Oh. Um, you got a minute? Um, yeah, I'm just working. - So... - Uh-huh? Um, oh, I got you a birthday present. Oh, wow, you remembered. Oh. It's a Judy Jetson Thermos. Right. Like the kind you... Right. Oh, I got something for you too. How'd you know I was coming? Um, yeah, um, "twin" thing. I can't believe you did this. I can't believe you... ...did this.

chunk_00017.caption:

Central Perk coffee shop — daytime, warm ambient lighting with wood paneling and bar area visible.

Monica and Rachel enter the scene from a doorway, approach a counter, and begin speaking to a staff member in a blue uniform. ### **DIALOGUE CONTEXT:**
Phoebe discusses her relationship with Joey Tribbiani with the other blonde woman, expressing that he is "so nutsy about you" and that he "will figure it out." The conversation has a casual, slightly teasing tone, with Phoebe appearing animated and the other woman reacting with a smile. Monica and Rachel are engaged in a separate conversation at the counter, discussing a form that needs a signature.

### **TEMPORAL NOTES:**
Phoebe stands up and walks toward the bar area.
Monica and Rachel enter the scene from the doorway and approach the counter.
chunk_00017.subtitles: So, what's the deal with, um, you and Joey? Oh, right. He is so great. But that's over. - Does he know? - Who? Joey. You know, um, ahem, he's really nutsy about you. He is? Why? - You got me. - Right. Excuse me... ...doesn't this come with a side salad? So, um, are you gonna call him? - What, you think he likes me? - No. Joey. Oh. No, no. He is so smart. He'll figure it out. Do you want some chicken? No, no. No food with a face, remember? You have not changed. Yeah, you too. - Hi. Remember us? - Mm-hm. Um, yeah, you just called about needing a signature on the admissions form? Well, it turns out we need a whole new one.

Monkey jumps onto chair
Ross begins writing in notepad
Chandler gestures while speaking
chunk_00018.subtitles: Well, it turns out we need a whole new one. Because, um, you see... ...I put the wrong name again. - Because, um... - You're that stupid. I am. I'm that stupid. Yeah, and I'm just gonna pay for this with a check. You know, your insurance will cover that. Yeah, I know. I'm just not that bright either. Okay, worst case scenario: - Say you never feel like a father. - Uh-huh. Say your son never feels connected to you as one. Say all of his relationships are affected by this. Do you have a point? You know, you'd think I would. [MARCEL GASPING] What's up with the simian? It's just a fur ball. Okay, whose turn is it? Yours. I just got 43 points for "kidney." No, you got zero points for "idney." I had a K. Where's my K?

chunk_00019.subtitles: I had a K. Where's my K? [GASPING] You've got to help me. My monkey swallowed a K. Get that animal out of here. The animal hospital is way across town. He's choking. I don't know what to do. - What's going on? - Marcel swallowed a Scrabble tile. Excuse me. This hospital is for people. Lady, he is people. He has a name, okay? He watches Jeopardy... ...he touches himself when nobody's watching. Please, have a heart. - I'll take a look at him. - Oh, thank you. - Michael. - Rachel. - What? - Monica. - Oh. - Hi. Hey. Urs. What are you doing here? I've been trying to call you.

Phoebe moves closer to Joey during the conversation
chunk_00020.subtitles: What are you doing here? I've been trying to call you. Listen, um... Don't say "listen." I know that "listen." I've said that "listen." I'm sorry. I don't get it. What happened? What about everything you said under the bridge? Yeah, um, ahem... You know, just forget about what I said under the bridge. I was talking crazy that night. I was so drunk. You don't drink. That's right, I don't. But I was drunk on you. - Oh, Urs. - But, yeah, so it's not gonna work. Why? Is it because I'm friends with Phoebe? If it was, would you stop hanging out with her? No. No, I couldn't do that. Um, then, yeah, it's because of Phoebe. So you know, it's either her or me. Then, uh... Then I'm sorry.

chunk_00021.caption:
### **SCENE SETTING:**
Central Perk coffee shop — daytime, warm ambient lighting with neon signs visible

Phoebe Buffay: dark cardigan with red trim over white top - black pants - blonde hair in a braid - expression shifts from engaged to shocked

### **ACTIONS AND INTERACTIONS:**
Joey Tribbiani sits on the orange couch and leans in to kiss Phoebe Buffay on the cheek, then pulls back. Phoebe reacts with shock, covering her mouth with her hand. Joey stands up and walks away, leaving Phoebe sitting on the couch, still holding her hand to her mouth.

### **OBJECTS AND PROPS:**
- Orange couch (center of frame)
- Wooden coffee table (with newspapers and ashtray)

### **DIALOGUE CONTEXT:**

### **TEMPORAL NOTES:**

Joey Tribbiani moves from sitting to standing and walking away
chunk_00021.subtitles: Then, uh... Then I'm sorry. You know... ...you're gonna be really, really hard to get over. I know. I don't know whether it's just because we're breaking up or what... ...but you have never looked so beautiful. Really? - Pheebs? - Yeah.

chunk_00022.caption:

Hospital room — daytime, fluorescent lighting
The setting is a clinical room with medical equipment, cabinets, and a gurney covered with a sheet.

### **CHARACTERS PRESENT:**
Ross Geller: brown jacket - blue plaid shirt - short, dark hair - concerned expression
Chandler Bing: dark-colored sweater with light stripes - light-colored pants - short, dark hair - serious expression
Rachel Green: light-colored long-sleeved top - plaid pants - dark hair - concerned expression
Joey Tribbiani: dark-colored jacket - dark pants - short, dark hair - concerned expression
Phoebe Buffay: dark-colored coat with red trim - dark pants - blonde, shoulder-length hair - concerned expression
Unidentified person: brown jacket - blue plaid shirt - short, dark hair - concerned expression (appears to be Ross Geller, but visual is ambiguous)

### **ACTIONS AND INTERACTIONS:**
Ross Geller sits beside a gurney, speaking to the group while gesturing. Chandler Bing, Rachel Green, and Phoebe Buffay stand around the gurney, looking down at the covered figure with concern. Joey Tribbiani stands near the group, also looking down. The group collectively reacts to the situation, with Ross speaking and the others listening intently. The camera focuses on Ross as he talks, then shifts to show the group's reactions.

### **OBJECTS AND PROPS:**
Gurney: covered with white sheet (center of frame)
Medical equipment: white device with red dial (on wall)
Cabinets: light-colored (on wall)
Oxygen tank: white (in background)
Clock: red dial (on wall)
Monkey: capuchin monkey (on gurney, revealed later)

### **DIALOGUE CONTEXT:**
Ross Geller discusses the monkey's condition with the group. The conversation has a serious tone, with Ross appearing concerned and the others reacting with worry. The group is focused on the monkey, which is revealed to be recovering after surgery.

### **TEMPORAL NOTES:**
Ross Geller stands up and moves to the gurney
Phoebe Buffay moves to stand beside Rachel Green
Chandler Bing steps forward to look at the gurney
Ross Geller gestures toward the gurney while speaking
The camera focuses on the monkey on the gurney
Ross Geller looks down at the monkey and smiles
chunk_00022.subtitles: He looks so tiny. - We just got the message. - Is he all right? Yeah, the doctor got the K out. He also found an M and an O. We think he was trying to spell out "monkey." The doctor says he'll be fine. He's just sleeping now. So you feel like a dad yet? No. Why? Hey, come on, you came through. You did what you had to do. That is very dad. Oh, look, he's waking up. ROSS: Hey, fella. How you doing?
